result.execSummary:
The defendant Porsha L Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) AMENDED FROM RT - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No retail clothing stores at all.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

charges.descr: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) AMENDED FROM  RT - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Porsha L Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Porsha L Thompson in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
State moves to amend Ct. 1 to two counts of misd Theft.
Plea:  Cts. 1&2 - G.
BTC:  Cts. 1&2 - GUILTY.  
6 mo RCJ, I/S, 1 year probation.  May be transferred to Brown County.
Conditions:
No alc/cs;
No retail clothing outlets at all;
CC+DNA surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to adjourn and change of plea.
Pre-trial conference on May 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Porsha L Thompson in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, JCPenny except for restitution purposes.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Porsha L Thompson in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
